holidays.name: Evaluate Your Life Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to pausing and reflecting on your personal goals, achievements, and general life direction ‚Äî a quirky self-assessment holiday!
holidays.origin: Created in 1985 by author and motivational speaker Angel Adelung who wanted people to take a moment for serious self-reflection amid busy lives.
holidays.funFact: Some people use this day to write themselves letters listing their life goals and reviewing progress from previous years.

holidays.name: Dance Dress Day
holidays.description: An unusual observance inviting everyone to wear their fanciest dance attire all day just for fun‚Äîeven if you don't dance!
holidays.origin: Started in the mid-2000s by a small dance community promoting creativity and joy through everyday dressing up.
holidays.funFact: Even offices have joined in by hosting mini dance parties during breaks on this day.

holidays.name: Chewing Gum Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the sticky, stretchy, and sometimes flavorful treat that has been blowing bubbles and freshening breath for ages.
holidays.origin: Traced back unofficially to 1869 when Thomas Adams patented the first commercial chewing gum made from chicle.
holidays.funFact: Bubble gum was originally pink simply because that was the only color of the gum available when first invented.

holidays.name: Desserts Day
holidays.description: A delightfully sweet day promoting the consumption of all kinds of desserts, from cakes to puddings to extravagant pastries.
holidays.origin: Origin unknown, but enjoyed by dessert lovers worldwide as a reason to indulge their sweet tooth guilt-free.
holidays.funFact: Some people celebrate by trying to guess the origins of popular desserts while sampling them.
